website_summaries.verdict: One-handed operation speeds up pitting process. Good longevity in a kitchen tool.
pros: Performs well with successful pitting nearly every time
Can be placed in a dishwasher for cleaning
Will lock into closed position for easy storage
cons: Works better with smaller and medium-sized cherries than with larger ones

customer_reviews.title: Best pitcher ever
customer_reviews.text: Works great for canning! I went through several buckets of cherries we had at a u-pick in a matter of hours. It doesn't make a mess and even a 5 year old can use it. Only complaint there isn't instructions on how to unlock the pitcher. I had to scroll through the instructions and find a review that would told me about the hidden latch at the end that makes it magically open so you can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica P.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This pitter works great! We used it to pit a whole bunch of cherries for dehydrating, and it made the job so much faster than otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: JessicaW

customer_reviews.title: Falls Apart Easier Than Pits Leave the Cherry.
customer_reviews.text: Cherry #1... this thing is amazing! Cherry #5...huh is this stick park supposed to come off? Maybe for cleaning? Cherry #7...yeah no. It is not meant to come off... Cherry #10...huh is the bottom plastic slip under the metal tension spring supposed to fly off too? Cherry #12...F this...gonna get the OXO brand and see if that makes it beyond putting a dozen cherries...
customer_reviews.author: E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: It broke in a different way every time I used it until it was completely unusable
customer_reviews.text: I managed to use this product three times each time I pitted and ate most of a bag of cherries. When I went to rinse the utensil off, the prong that pits the fruit broke right off. I was able to rig it back into place however the next time I used it, the main part of the handle just broke off while I was washing it off again. Very cheap plastic. Maybe you'll get lucky and get one that has more glue holding it together than mine!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Panno

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR OLIVES
customer_reviews.text: Useless for olives which is the sole reason I bought this. After searching for an affordable product I settled on this one because it specifically points out its efficacy for putting olives. The product is super lightweight and just doesn't stand up to olives. I already have a cherry pitter that handles multiple at once, and also does not work for olives. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jen s

customer_reviews.title: Okay with a little gorilla glue
customer_reviews.text: the item does what it is supposed to do. easy to clean, handy closure tab (although it is hard to push or pull), easy to use. The issue I had is, After pitting my first 10 cherries, the pitter part (that pushes the pit through) detached from the handle. finished my first 5lb with it falling out every 4th or 5th cherry. Before I started working on my second box (18lb), I got some gorilla glue out and got it stuck in there good. Worked like a charm after that.
customer_reviews.author: Kathaleen

customer_reviews.title: The pits
customer_reviews.text: Only one cherry at a time but does the job. Keep watch make sure pit comes out, angle of cherry sometimes wouldn't come out...one out thirty.
customer_reviews.author: Omle57FNH

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Works exactly as described. It has even encouraged my daughter, a reluctant fruit eater, to eat more cherries. So I'm 100% happy with my new cherry pitter.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Leiker

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't decide between the $8 or $12 cherry pitter. Went with the cheaper one because I don't plan on using it all that often. But I would have liked to use it more than once. The piece that holds the metal prong fell out, like it was never intended to stay there. Then the piece that prevents the upper arm from smashing the cherry broke off. What the? Who designed this thing? And how can you really sell something so terrible? So sad :-(.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It worked pretty good on most cherry’s. However, and some cherries it Missed the pits. It kind of pushes him to the side. I found the safest way to use it, was to push the pits in your hand so you know the pig came out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pelissier

customer_reviews.title: Unit broke after 5 minutes of use. Hopefully replacement will be better.
customer_reviews.text: This unit broke after 5 minutes of use. It appeared to be built well but the rod that pushes the pit through popped off.
customer_reviews.author: MFormby

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good product
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, really gets the job done! We will see though when my cherry tree starts to REALLY produce fruit next year. It seems pretty sturdy and doesn’t get stuck like many other pitters do.
customer_reviews.author: E. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Why would anyone pit cherries if you have this? It's worth any penny and it's super easy to use. Whoever did this was thinking. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jayjay

customer_reviews.title: Not for small cherries
customer_reviews.text: When they give the description that it can do small cherries, I guess they don't know the size of cherries that grow in Minnesota. Out of pitting 1.5# of my cherries it only worked a handful of times. It was sturdy. Never cleaned it threw it away cause I never want to pit my cherries with that again. It's very messy juice goes everywhere "obviously." Need to find a cherry pitter for MN cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No More Funny Looking Cherries
customer_reviews.text: Easy to Use! I tried to pit cherries with a knife and they were pretty funny looking. If you have a lot of cherries, probably will be too slow to pit them, but for the occasional batch of cherries, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JCF

customer_reviews.title: love it but it fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I love this cherry pitter. My daughter had one and showed it to me and i ordered one for myself and one for a friend. But now the "head" of it has come apart and I'm past the window to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Works if you’ve got some superglue
customer_reviews.text: It works...when the top (shiny metal) piece isn’t falling out. I had to use superglue to glue it back up into the tool...
customer_reviews.author: Sonnet Murray

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: It's useless. It falls apart from the start. And it first started happening after only using it the first time. And by the 10th cherry. We're going to try and crazy glue it. But I think I'll just have to buy an all stainless steel one.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M Dienes

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: Great for cherries and olives. Put the cherry into red cup and squeeze. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: vichris

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 10 cherries
customer_reviews.text: I returned the utensil after pitting 10 cherries. It broke ! Very weak construction.
customer_reviews.author: Buster

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of porly designed and manufactured junk - DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: It broke after 15 cherries. Cheap materials, bad design. Too small for many cherries, misaligned pitter. Total junk. Not even worth returning for another piece of the same junk. Calling this item "heavy duty" is a joke. Cheap, lightweight plastic.
customer_reviews.author: mojo425

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well! Cherry juice does spray around the general area where you're working so be prepared for that. But it does what it's supposed to do reliably.
customer_reviews.author: gunther17

customer_reviews.title: No hassle! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product takes all the work out of either the cherries or the olives to de pit.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of using this cherry pitter...works great...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Well since it broke after 25 cherries or so I gotta say this item sucked!
customer_reviews.author: Christine amanda

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy here but happy to have the utensil, did not use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have a feel of quality, and indeed it broke down after pitting 50 cherries
customer_reviews.author: Kloomnik

customer_reviews.title: broke
customer_reviews.text: not as smooth operating as i would like, and broke after using it twice. also noticed that the metal part started to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Item broke after 3 times uses, I wouldn't recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Leo R.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: Product does exactly as advertised, I absolutely love it 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: maritza curtiellas

customer_reviews.title: Plastic - not well made
customer_reviews.text: Broke the second time we used it. Entire thing broke into 4 pieces.
customer_reviews.author: MOM-NJ

customer_reviews.title: Already broken.
customer_reviews.text: Broke on first use. The metal pitter broke off of the handle and cannot be clicked back in.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Cherry Dream
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. Thought it might not hold up because of it being plastic, but after 15 pounds of cherries and a wash, it is as good as new. May take some time, but it works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Eat more cherries!
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, does what it is designed to accomplish. Light weight, seemingly well made. I would have like some information as to whether it can be run through the dishwasher, but other than that, it will likely be purchased again as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for olives.
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well for a short time on Queen Olives, then the bottom red part broke and came out and that was it. Totally useless now.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.text: Works surprisingly well. Gets the pits out of cherries with a single squeeze. Makes very little mess. Leaves the cherries in good shape. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for quality.
customer_reviews.text: Just dont buy this product, we had to superglue it back together the first time we used it. It's a cherry pitter, come on guys...
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Cothran

customer_reviews.title: Best one ever.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this thing. It's the best cherry pitter I've ever used. I've always had to make sure pits are out with other putters but this thing gets the pit out every time. I really love it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: P McB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing on how well it works. I wish I would have had this unit years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: Even if I only use this thing 3 times a year, it was more than worth the 9 bucks I spent on it, and completely worth the space in the drawer. It’s kinda fun ejecting the pit into the sink, and afterwards, you get a whole, unsmooshed cherry. Fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Wunji Lau

customer_reviews.title: Repair Required
customer_reviews.text: The pitter seems to work fine on cherries once you glue it together. The pit bar and the retainer both fell off after just a few cherries. Since I glued them back in place it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product! Broke after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: This item broke after one use, the metal poker fell off and looks like it was only held on by glue and not a solid plastic piece. Dont waste your money on this, spend a little extra and get an all metal one.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison S.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The quality is lacking here. It feels cheap in the hand and likes to jam up.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Handy gadget
customer_reviews.text: Works great on all size cherries. Makes it easy to pit several cherries to eat or put in a smoothie!
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Duck

customer_reviews.title: ... pitter on both cherries and olives and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pitter on both cherries and olives and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Nora Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good kitchen tool for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Convenient tool that makes cherry pitting very easy. Well made and does not feel like a cheap construction for the tool. It's addicting! Removal of pit doesn't remove much of the fruit center either, so I don't feel like I am wasting my fruit.Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: Had to glue a part back together that did not stay fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product.  Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Falls apart while using. Don’t you know what glue is???
customer_reviews.author: Pooh

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first use.
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in a smashed box and looked dirty. After I washed it, it fell apart the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It does what it’s supposed to and easy to use. Has held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ltags

customer_reviews.title: The plunger kept breaking off from the tooL.
customer_reviews.text: I had to keep putting it back together after doing one or two cherries. So I bought another brand and it worked fine
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Twomey

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The plunger that pits the cherries broke off before we had pitted even one bag of cherries😒.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest piece of junk ever used. Fell apart and broke in seconds. Ordered a replacement and it also immediately broke
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: This gadget came apart after every punch of a cherry. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Emily DeVries

customer_reviews.title: Work really well!
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to use. I've never used one before. Very convenient. I'm more willing to eat cherries because of it!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Pitted two cherries great, then immediately broke. Don’t buy. Very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Gina B

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: Functionality is good and easy to use but came apart the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lee Paglialonga

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: A little messy, but does the job great. Simple design.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Cressall

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Broke after pitting 3 olives! POS! Would love a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: The metal part that goes through the cherry falls out during use.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Pronovost

customer_reviews.title: Buy a metal one
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. It broke the first day I used it.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was wary of whether a cherry pitter would work at all. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, sturdy, easy to use, Excellent seller response, delivered in one day !
customer_reviews.author: carolyn davis

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Doesn’t work at all! Could not pit one cherry!
customer_reviews.author: francis  ciaccio

customer_reviews.title: No mess cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. He was always a mess after pitting a bunch of cherries with a knife & was not aware that there was such a tool.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mascaro

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product
customer_reviews.text: This item broke after 20 cherries. I immediately contact seller and they said they would send out a replacement - which never happened. I had 20 pounds of cherries to process and did so with a wine bottle and a small metal funnel. 8 hours later they were done. To this day - 3 weeks later, I have never seen a replacement. I won't buy from this seller again
customer_reviews.author: J Turner

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful- works
customer_reviews.text: Every spring I always look out for rhe 1st sign of cherries! Love them. I keep seeing these cherry pitters and just never found the need for it until now. Im tired of waiting for good cherries so I bought one of these so I could remove the pits and freeze the cherries for a rainy day. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Noelle C.

customer_reviews.title: this worked great! Had a bowl of cherries on the counter
customer_reviews.text: Bought 10 lbs of cherries.this worked great! Had a bowl of cherries on the counter, and 2 bowls in the sink. Dropped cherry into pitter, quick squeeze, flipped pit into 1 bowl, cherry into another. Got thru them all in 30 minutes. Closes for easy storage. Very comfortable to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Costello

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a piece of garbage. Arrived all marred up with little scratches. Looks used out of grandma’s utensil drawer. Had glue drip marks around edges as if a ten yr old tried fixing it back together. Ordered a 2nd one. It arrived in same appointment condition
customer_reviews.author: Albud

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This is just wonderful I just love it Pitts even olives love my Spanish olives
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly fine
customer_reviews.text: Pitts cherries perfectly, and works like a charm for olives as well. Would buy again, but probably won't have to, because it will last a long while!
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Magnolia, TX

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I used it, not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived I used it the same day and after using it on about 10 cherries, the cherry potter broke in my hand. Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.author: GodisEnough21

customer_reviews.title: It Broke!
customer_reviews.text: This broke apart completely the first time I used it, after pitting about 30 cherries. I had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: lmaskey

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived as promised and performed as expected for the first few cherries, but then the handle came apart making it very difficult to use. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Will break.
customer_reviews.text: Broke the second day we had it. Cheaply made. Buy a metal one.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother
customer_reviews.text: Broke on the second cherry, the first time I used it....what a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Gerald M Clark

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations for this but this thing is AWESOME!! Works so well with cherries, can't wait to try with olives. Definitely buying for my family members!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Broke second time I used it
customer_reviews.text: The steel shaft detached from the plastic handle. I was able to return it through Amazon for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It's so easy to use. Only problem I had was it delivered on a Sunday and our post office delivery person can't tell the difference between a 4 and a 6 so they delivered it to the wrong address. This happened twice. When I finally received the product I used it right away. Worked great . Am so glad I ordered this.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and no stained hands!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly never knew there was a "thing" to help with pitting cherries, but boy am I glad I do now! This is perfect, and fits in my semi-small hands without issue!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Brookman

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect every time!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. Works perfectly every time. Wish I had one years ago. Order with confidence from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The item broke after use 1. I thought the piece purposely came apart but after further review it was broken. I used it once to take the pits out of a handful of cherries.
customer_reviews.author: NJ mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased. Works well but prefer the OXO one. Needed another cherry pitter when working with someone to make jams, syrups, etc.
customer_reviews.author: beege

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Broke after two weeks of intermittently putting olives, darn those delicious jerks
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to wear latex gloves and an apron or you will look like Christian Bale in American Psycho.
customer_reviews.author: RupertPupkin

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: It pits cherries. Easy to wash. Easy to use. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Spiva-Evans

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: cherry pies are a breeze with this, no splatter or stains

customer_reviews.title: Broke at first use.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a solid product, but it broke during first use.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I use it 4 or 5 times a week. The only problem I had was I had to glue the post back in. But now perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Geist

customer_reviews.title: meh...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job I guess. I was going to return it, but for $8 bucks I'll throw it in the kitchen junk drawer. Maybe I'll make bourbon-soaked cherries this winter.
customer_reviews.author: David Theis

customer_reviews.title: So nice to sit down to a bowl of cherries and ...
customer_reviews.text: So nice to sit down to a bowl of cherries and not have to spit out seeds. I recommend it to all my friends.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after second use

customer_reviews.text: This fell apart after after putting about 10 cherries. I ended up using a knife to put them.

customer_reviews.title: Neat and clean and does the job

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for olives.
customer_reviews.text: This item is very fragile. It broke halfway through our first bottle of olives. Will be returning for refund.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool!!!! Since this is cherry season, I use it every day and love having cherries for breakfast!

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like the cherry pitter. It did not work all the time.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I would avoid buying Bing cherries because the pits are such a pain in the butt.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and fast
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised! So easy to use and fast!

customer_reviews.text: So easy to use! My 3 year old has no problem using it.

product_meta.title: YouTensils Cherry Pitter Stoner - Olive Pitter Tool Heavy Duty | Simple & Durable | Includes Cherry Recipe EBOOK (Black)
feature_bullets: Simple to Use: Easy one hand use with no hand fatigue, quickly pits cherries, no assembly required & easy to clean. There is a locking system for easy compact storage
Perfect Cherries: Pits Cherries without bruising and wasting fruit. Ideal for Bing and Rainier Cherries as well as big or small Cherries.
Lifetime Use: Professional heavy-duty designed to last for years. Combination of high grade plastic and metal for lifetime long use.
Dishwasher Safe: Will not stain or discolor from Dishwasher or Cherry Juice
Warranty: YouTensils will provides a 120 return policy, if the Cherry Pitter breaks we will replace no questions asked.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars254 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
